name: single-insight
description: Share a non-obvious insight from your industry expertise
hooks: Most people think {{common_belief}}. Here's what actually works:
The {{topic}} mistake I see most often:
After {{timeframe}} in {{industry}}, here's what I've learned:
examples:
Most people think more outreach = more deals.

After 5 years in B2B sales, here's what actually works:

10 deeply researched emails > 100 generic ones

The difference? Response rates jumped from 2% to 18%.

The hiring mistake I see most often:

Optimizing for skills over curiosity.

Skills can be taught. A growth mindset can't.

Every A-player I've hired asked more questions in the interview than I did.
tips: Be specific with numbers when possible
Challenge conventional wisdom (if you can back it up)
